head.supplied: 18th April 1867 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I am directed by the Governor to inform you that His Excellency has been requested by the Right Honorable the Earl of Carnarvon to convey to you His Lordship's acknowledgem...

div.p: Unit 2, p. 232, VPRS 1092 Governor's letter books, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: Carnarvon wrote to the Governor of Victoria, Sir Henry Manners-Sutton, on 18 February 1867 acknowledging the receipt of a despatch with which was enclosed a copy of M to H. Manners-Sutton, 23 November 1866 (in this edition as 66-11-23a), and asking Manners-Sutton to convey his thanks to M (No. 15, unit 21, VPRS 1087 despatches from Secretary of State to Governor, VA 466 Governor, Public Record Office, Victoria). 18th April 1867

I am directed by the Governor to inform you that His Excellency has been requested by the Right Honorable the Earl of Carnarvon to convey to you His Lordship's acknowledgements for your attention in sending home a copy of the Journal of the late Mr McIntyre.
McIntyre (1866).
